public boolean loginToServer(user inputUser)

moveUserChannel

public java.lang.Boolean moveUserChannel(user inputUser,
                                         channel inputChannel)
Moves the user with the to the channel specified in . Works like the "drag & drop" functionality of the client, so it basicly overrules passwords, userlimits and sticky flags

Parameters:
inputUser - User you like move
inputChannel - channelObject destination.
Returns:
Result of command.

packetLoss

public java.lang.String packetLoss(server inputServer)
Will display the average packet loss of the virtual server that is either currently selected (-> sel), or that is specified in . This value is a good indication to see if something is going wrong on the server side (e.g. the bandwidth the server has doesnt suffice). On a good server with mostly users from close-by (e.g. European users on an European server) the value should be under 1%. If it rises to 5% or more you will have major problems using this server to talk.

Parameters:
inputServer - serverObject you like get packetLoss
Returns:
String of packetLoss

getLog

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getLog(java.lang.Integer inputMaxLigne)
Log command will print the last 30 lines of server log, if invoked without a parameter, else it will print as many lines as you specify, always starting from the end of the log

Parameters:
inputMaxLigne - not use this function with strong ligne number.
Returns:
ArrayList String of ligneLog.

addLogLigne

public java.lang.Boolean addLogLigne(java.lang.String inputLigne)
This is used to set a remark in the serverlog. It is useful if you want to find a specific place in the log file later. For example if you notice a problem and want to look at the log closer some time to find out what was up

Parameters:
inputLigne - message to add logFile.
Returns:
Result of command.

getBanList

public java.util.ArrayList<banObject> getBanList()

Returns:
ArrayList of banObject

addBan

public java.lang.Boolean addBan(banObject inputBan)
This will put the IP you specified on the banlist of the currently selected server. Also note that the IP may contain wildcards, just like known from the client banlist. So, you could use the wildcard "*" to ban more than only one guy, or to ban whole netmasks/providers. You can also specify a time after the IP, measured in minutes, which will make your ban become a "time ban", meaning it will only last for as long as you specified.

Parameters:
inputBan - banObject
Returns:
Result of command.

delBan

public java.lang.Boolean delBan(banObject inputBan)
This will delete the ban specified by ban_id (->getBanlist) out of the banlist of the selected server.

Parameters:
inputBan - banObject
Returns:
Result of command.

clearBan

public java.lang.Boolean clearBan()
Is used to delete all bans that your banlist contains, maybe useful if you gave the wrong guy Admin and want to clean-up your messed up banlist

Returns:
Result of command.

banPlayer

public java.lang.Boolean banPlayer(user inputUser)
This is handy if you dont want to look up the IP of somebody connected to your server, but just want to ban him. The IP of player corresponding to the ID is banned. Note: This is ban only, no kick occurs. banplayer can also be used to place "time bans", that is bans that only last for a certain amount of time. The option is measured in minutes.

Parameters:
inputUser - objectUser
Returns:
Result of command.
